msContents.summary:
I) Taʾāmra Māryām “Miracles of Mary" (fols. 3ra-183rb) I-1a) Maṣḥafa śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 3ra-8rb) I-1b) Maṣḥafa śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fol. 10ra-14rb) I-2) ʾƎsaggǝd läki wa-ʾǝweddǝsäki ... “I worship Thee ...” and hymns (fols. 14rb-15rb) I-3a) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 15va-18ra) I-3b) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 19r a-20rb) I-4) Taʾāmra Māryām “Miracles of Mary”: 123+4 miracles (fols. 20va-176va), incomplete? I-5) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi... "Does not the man..." (fols. 177ra-181rb) I-6) Ba-ʾakkʷateta la-ʾab wa-wald wa-manfas qǝddus ʾǝwaṭṭǝn ṣǝḥifä täʾamriha … “Glorifying the father and the son and the holy spirit I begin to write her miracles …” (fol. 183ra-rb)
Additiones 1-7, colophon.

msItem.note: The miracles of St Mary (Text I-4) are numbered.
Text I-5 comprises 33 strophes which are strophes 1-31, 33-34 according to GrohHymn pp. 336-53.
Text I-5 is followed by a subscriptio stating the number of stophes of Text I-5 (33) and of the miracles of Text I-4 (134): ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለማርያም፡ ዝውእቱ፡ አኮኑ፡ ብእሲ፡ ፴፫፡ ወኵሉ፡ ድሙር፡ ፻ወ፴፬። …

msContents.colophon: ff. 181va-182ra: ተፈጸመት፡ ዘቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ በ፪፻ወ፶፡ ዓመተ ምሕረት፡ <…>በመዋዕሊሆሙ፡ <…> ዘነበረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ … Several lines of the extensive colophon have been erased. The writing of the Ms. was completed in 250 year of mercy (= 1598 A.D. or 1674 A.D., cp. ChChron 166,167).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 186.0 folios, of which blank ff. 1v, 2r, 8vb, 9r, 18v, 89vb, 90r, 91v, 92r, 161v, 182rb, 182v, 184r-185v, 186v., in 26.0 quires (A+25).
27.5 21.0 9.0

signatures.note: - Undecorated quire mark written in the inter column of the upper ruled line: fols. 10r: ፩ (hand b).

list.item: 8 XIX(8; s.l.: 1, stub after 7; 8, no stub /fols. 138r-145v)

4
XXV(4/fols. 183r-186v)
f. 145 is sewn onto the stub of fol. 138 (quire XIX).

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. shows traces of extensive use and was rebound. Quires II was added later. The bifolio with the miniature (fols. 90-91) might orginate from a different codex. The Ms. seems to be incomplete as in Text I-4 the miracles are numbered until 123 whereas 134 miracles are mentioned in the subscriptio on fol. 181rb. f. 18 was cut, only the portion with the text is preserved. f. 145 was added later, sewn onto the stub of fol. 138 (quire XIX). Holes or tears amended on fols. 12, 51, 54, 99, 116, 123, 148, 159, 164, 167, 168.

layout.note: Quires: I, III-XXV: all data for fol. 4r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Quire: II: all data for fol. 11r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: Hand a: fine but somewhat irregular. Hand b, c, d: mediocre. Black, red (hand a: vivid red and strong red, hand b: strong crimson, hand c: vivid red, hand d: strong red). Täwälädä Madḫǝn (hand a). Ḫayla Māryām (hand b).Täwälädä Madḫǝn is mentioned as the scribe in the subscriptio on fol. 181rb (erased but legible). Quire II is written in the same hand as Ms. BMQM-004 (the scribe Ḫayla Māryām).Hand a: Second half of the 16th cent; b: first half of the 20th cent.; c: second half of the 18th cent. (?); d: 20th cent.

Hand a, Täwälädä Madḫǝn: Texts I-a, I-3b, I-4, I-5, I-6 (quires I, III-XXV). The handwriting appears irregular throughout the Ms. and changes from careful and neat with slender, broadly spaced and right-sloping letters (quires I, XIV-XXIV) to mediocre resulting in an uneven script with irregularly slanted letters (quires III-XIII). Probably the text was written at several stages.
Hand b, Ḫayla Māryām: quire II (Texts I-b, I-2a and I-3a), recent.
Hand c: fols. 89r, 92v (two added miracles of Mary).
Hand d: fols. 144ra-145vb (two added miracles of Mary).

decoDesc.decoNote:
Nomina sacra; names of the donors (erased); the words salām “salutation” and hale luya in Text I-1a, elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1a, I-1b, I-3b, I-4, I-5 and I-6, alternating with black lines; several groups of lines in the incipit of Text I-2, alternating with black lines; two initial lines in the incipit of Text I-3a; groups of lines on the incipit page of sections of Texts I-1b and I-3a alternating with black lines; two initial lines of the sections of Texts I-1a and I-4 (sometimes alternating with black lines) and its section numbers; first word of each strophe of Text I-5.
f. 20rb: (explicit of Text I-2b): coloured (red in black) ornamental band; geometric motifs.

list.item:
f. 1r: Unclear note.
The note is written in Amharic, in pencil.

f. 1r: Unclear note.
The note is written in Amharic, in the same hand that wrote Additio 1, in pencil.

f. 8va: salām laki ḫoḫǝta mǝśrāq... "Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…".
Partly rubricated.

f. 176vb: Donation note.f. 176vb: <...> ዘማርያም፡ <...> ገበዝሂ፡ <...> ወንጉሥነ። ኢዮአስ፡ ወጳጳስነ፡ አባ፡ ዮሐንስ። ወዘተሣየጣ፡ በንዋየ፡ <...> …
According to this note, the Ms. was donated during the time of King ʾIyoʾas (r. 1755-69) and Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs III (in tenure 1745-1761). The name of the donors have been erased.

f. 176va-vb: Donation note.f. 176va: ዘወሀበት፡ ተአምር፡ ቅድስተ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወምስለ፡ ፍቁራ፡ ተስፋ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ዛቲ፡ ተአምረ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘወሀበት፡ ለፀበላ፡ ማርያም፡ ወወሰድዋ፡ ኃያላን፡ ወተሳየጠት፡ ዳግመ፡ ወወሀበቶሙ፡ ኤጴስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ወልደ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወአቡነ፡ [fol. 176vb] ወልደ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ አቡነ፡ መዝገበ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ቀሳውስት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ እድ፡ ወአንስት፡ …
The beginning of the note is written over erasure. It mentions Qǝddǝstä Krǝstos and Tasfā Mikāʾel as donors, written in the same, more recent hand that inserted those and other names to supplication formulas. The note states that the book was taken by "violent people" after its donation to Ṣäbäla Māryām, then bought back and again given to the monastery during the tenure of ʾǝṗis qoṗos (?) Walda Krǝstos, ʾabuna Walda Giyorgis and ʾabuna Mazgaba Śǝllāse.
f. 183va-vb: Record concerning commemoration of some individuals (?)

- Sketch for an ornamental band on fol. 183ra. - Corrections written over erasures (hand a): fols. 7ra, 29ra, 42ra, 73ra, 76ra, 77rb, 100vb, 121ra, 137ra, 142ra, 151rb, 159vb (linger passage), 162vb. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally (hand b): e.g., fols. 12rb, 13va, 17ra, 18va, - An extensive passage (incipit of the 111th miracle) has been erased from fol. 161rb. - Writing exercises: fols. 9va, 11r, 183r, 183v, 186r (with an ornamental band) - Crude note, in pencil on fol. 182v. - Scribbles on fol. 34r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (for the most part hidden under the secondary textile cover); textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish brown leather (at least four tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, x-form, cross hatching).

origin.origDate: According to the colophon, the Ms. was written in 250 year of mercy (= 1674 A.D.). It could be dated back also to 1598 A.D. (if the date is calculated according to the cicle of martyrs); this earlier date would better match the palaeographic features attested for hand a. Quire II is of much more recent time (first half of the 20th cent., cp. dated Ms. BMQM-004 written by the same hand). ff. 90 and 91 (with miniatures), originating from a different codex (?), probably date back to the 17th cent.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The name of the original donors have been erased throughout the Ms. and often crudely replaced with that of Qǝddǝstä Krǝstos and Tasfā Mikāʾel (see also Additio 6). Besides, many other names have been added in the same more recent hand: Walatta Dǝngǝl (fol. 23rb), Walatta Qāl (fols. 24va, 25vb), Walda Krǝstos (fol. 26va), and others The name of Walda Śǝllāse is written in the supplication formula on fol. 15vb, in hand b.
Täwälädä Madḫǝn (hand a). Ḫayla Māryām (hand b).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
